subject: Re: Reading and Writing Speed
msgSnippet: It was not what I wished to convey. The human brain can be a truly malfunctioning system.
messageBody:
It was not what I wished to convey. The human brain can be a truly malfunctioning system.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Vincent Reilly <vin.reilly@...> wrote:
>
> Tim, are you being facetious here, or was that not what you intended to
> convey?
> Vin
> On 4/12/2013 2:17 PM, Timothy wrote:
> >
> > Wow, hitting reload can really change a message before it sends.
> >
> > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, Vincent Reilly
> > <vin.reilly@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Dear Tim,
> > > Oh, snap!
> > > Now we can do a Humanist high-five!
> > > Vin ;-)
> > > On 4/11/2013 10:10 PM, Timothy wrote:
> > > >
> > > > That, and I'm putting major works of fiction into it, starting with
> > > > the Bible.
> > > >
> > > > http://sourceforge.net/projects/web-qs
> > > >
> > > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>
> > > > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, "stratocat6969"
> > > > <john-bergsma@> wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > The savings in physical effort are that much? I'm looking
> > forward to
> > > > that. So it is a private shorthand for you then?
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>
> > > > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@>
> > wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > If there is anything I write for myself in English (and
> > > > occasionally Spanish and Esperanto, still working those out) I write
> > > > it in QS. It saved me from carpal tunnel syndrome a few years back.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>
> > > > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, "stratocat6969"
> > > > <john-bergsma@> wrote:
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Hi Tim,
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Thanks for answering. Did you spend a lot of time per day at
> > it?
> > > > Do you still use it, and if so, what for?
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>
> > > > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@>
> > wrote:
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > In my case, it took about six months. I was alone in my
> > > > endeavor, which likely slowed me down since the only person I was
> > > > communicating with was my future self. A friend of mine managed to
> > > > master it in half the time since they used it to chat with me
> > > > occasionally online.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>
> > > > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, "stratocat6969"
> > > > <john-bergsma@> wrote:
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Has anyone achieved reading and writing speed with Senior
> > > > QuickScript approaching what they could do with normal cursive
> > > > handwriting? If so, how long did it take to get there?
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Thanks,
> > > > > > > > > John
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > >
> >
> >
>
